Name: Indians (Mauryas)
History: The Maurya Indians have excellent archers and a large number of champions, including war elephants, chariots, macemen, and Maiden Archers, who can swap weapons between sword and longbow. Their citizen infantry are low quality and cavalry are mediocre, but train quickly. Like the Chinese and Persians, the Indians have a +10% population cap bonus. Lastly, the Pillars of Ashoka boost nearby citizens.

Factions.Name: Maurya Indians
Factions.Description: Founded in 322 B.C. by Chandragupta Maurya, the Maurya Empire was the first to rule most of the Indian subcontinent, and was one of the largest and most populous empires of antiquity. Its military featured bowmen who used the long-range bamboo longbow, fierce female warriors, chariots, and thousands of armored war elephants. Its philosophers, especially the famous Acharya Chanakya, contributed to such varied fields such as economics, religion, diplomacy, warfare, and good governance. Under the rule of Ashoka the Great, the empire saw 40 years of peace, harmony, and prosperity.

Technologies.Name: Elephant Roundup
Technologies.Description: Capture up to 5 Gaia elephants and garrison them in the Elephant Stables to gain up to a 25% bonus in cost and train time of elephant units.

Technologies.Name: Archery Tradition
Technologies.History: India was a land of archery. The bulk of any Indian army was made up of highly skilled archers, armed with bamboo longbows.
Technologies.Description: Archer units firing rate +10% faster, train time reduced -25%, but health reduced -10%.

Technologies.Name: Arthaśāstra
Technologies.History: Chanakya is traditionally identified as the author of the Arthashastra, or 'The Science of Prosperity', an extensive treatise on how best to govern a large kingdom.
Technologies.Description: Chanakya can research 4 unique technologies based upon the Arthashastra.

Technologies.Name: Kṣhatriya Warrior Caste
Technologies.History: Chanakya is traditionally identified as the author of the Arthashastra, or 'The Science of Prosperity', an extensive treatise on how best to govern a large kingdom.

Technologies.Name: Wootz Steel
Technologies.History: Secret steel working techniques give sword blades distinctive and beautiful markings. Not only that, but the steel's hardness is unparalleled.

Heroes.Name: Ashoka the Great
Heroes.History: Last great emperor of the Maurya dynasty.

Heroes.Name: Acharya Chāṇakya
Heroes.History: Great teacher and advisor to Chandragupta Maurya.

CivBonuses.Name: Emperor of Emperors.
CivBonuses.History: The Maurya Empire encompassed dozens of formerly independent kingdoms over an area of 5 million square kilometers, with a population of close to 60 million people. The Maurya regents held the title Emperor of Emperors and commanded a standing army of 600,000 infantry, 9000 elephants, 8000 chariots, and 30,000 cavalry, making it arguably the largest army of its time.
CivBonuses.Description: Mauryas have a +10% population cap bonus (i.e., 550 pop cap instead of the usual 500).

CivBonuses.Name: Ksatradharma.
CivBonuses.History: Kshatriya or Kashtriya, meaning warrior, is one of the four varnas (social orders) in Hinduism. Traditionally Kshatriya constitute the military and ruling elite of the Vedic-Hindu social system outlined by the Vedas and the Laws of Manu. Ksatradharma eventually became to be known as the primary duty of war, or law of kings and warriors, which gave rise to the Kshatriya caste.
CivBonuses.Description: The Mauryas enjoy access to 4 champions.

CivBonuses.Name: Wooden Walls.
CivBonuses.History: The Mauryas built their city walls out of wood, an abundant natural resource in India.
CivBonuses.Description: City Walls -50% build time, but also -25% health.

TeamBonuses.Name: Ashoka's Proselytism.
TeamBonuses.History: Ashoka the Great sent embassies West to spread knowledge of the Buddha.
TeamBonuses.Description: Allied temples and temple technologies -50% cost, in resources and time.

Structures.Name: Elephant Stables
Structures.Special: Train the Elephant Archer and Worker Elephant at Town Phase, then also the champion War Elephant at City phase.

Structures.Name: Edict Pillar of Ashoka
Structures.Special: Contentment: Units +15% gather and build rates within 50 meters.
